justification: The study investigates the role of transposable element (TE) activation in cellular senescence, linking epigenetic changes such as hypomethylation to TE transcription and subsequent pro-inflammatory pathways. This directly contributes to our understanding of aging mechanisms and inflammation, which are central to longevity research.
key_terms: cellular senescence, transposable elements, hypomethylation, Alu, L1 RNA, cytoplasmic DNA, cGAS-STING pathway, type 1 IFN, sterile inflammation, inflammaging
